meanings.definition: To make someone uncertain or unable to understand something.
meanings.sent1: The new math concept can confuse some students.
meanings.sent2: The complicated instructions may confuse the readers.
meanings.sent3: Trying to read the map upside down can confuse even the best navigators.
meanings.sent4: Her jumbled speech confused the audience like a puzzle with missing pieces.
meanings.sent5: The magician's tricks are designed to confuse and amaze the audience.

meanings.definition: To mix up or jumble together.
meanings.sent1: Please don't confuse the clean and dirty laundry.
meanings.sent2: The wind can confuse the leaves, making them swirl in all directions.
meanings.sent3: The chef's messy kitchen may confuse the health inspector.
meanings.sent4: The artist's abstract painting seemed to confuse colors and shapes.
meanings.sent5: The busy intersection can confuse drivers with its multiple lanes and signals.

meanings.definition: To mistake one thing for another.
meanings.sent1: I always confuse the twins because they look so alike.
meanings.sent2: Don't confuse salt with sugar when baking cookies.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's clever disguise can confuse even his closest friends.
meanings.sent4: The shadows in the dimly lit room can confuse objects into strange shapes.
meanings.sent5: The mirror reflection can confuse pets, making them think there's another animal.
